title.narrative: 5.4 POLICY AND SYSTEMS

description.narrative: 5.4 MEST, Local Councils, schools and communities have the capacity to plan, implement and monitor equitable delivery of education services by end December 2019., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5.0 Improved learning outcomes and equitable and inclusive education for all boys and girls by 2018

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.4 MEST, Local Councils, schools and communities have the capacity to plan, implement and monitor equitable delivery of educationservices by end December 2019.

description.narrative: The Ministry of Basic and Senior Secondary Education (MBSSE) prioritised efficient and effective data collection and better utilisation to improve its planning, decision making and policy formulation capacities. This was evidenced by improved access and availability of quality school data through integrated systems including the establishment of a dashboard and alignment of the Situation Room to EMIS using the EduTrac platform resulting in better decision making for the equitable delivery of education services. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
